node.title: Solving an Euler-Lagrange equation to obtain vacancy profile
node.bodyText:
Hi,
I am trying to replicate the concentration profile of vacancies for critical nuclei using the expressions in Semenov and Woo paper. I have attached the paper below for reference. By solving Eqn. (9) in 1D and choosing the appropriate dirichlet boundary conditions for either end of the domain as shown in the input file, I was able to obtain vacancy profiles for different supersaturations. However, I could only solve the problem when the bulk free energy expression is in a polynomial form and couldn't do with the free energy expression given in the paper (see Eqn 20) because of the logarithm terms. I did specify in the kernel to use a Taylor expansion form for the logarithms when the value is less than 1e-04  and the source file is attached below. I need help in solving for the vacancy profile when a free energy expression with logarithms is considered.
I did see satisfactory results when I considered polynomial form, as it clearly shows that the critical nuclei decrease with an increase in supersaturation. The image is attached below and the arrow points to an increase in supersaturation of vacancies. Also, it would also be very helpful  if anyone can tell me how to solve the same problem in spherical coordinates.
Semenov, Woo - 2012 - Phase-field modeling of void formation and growth under irradiation(3).pdf
ADChemicalPotential.txt
Steady-state_nucleation.txt

Hello
Spherical coordinates should just be setting coord_type = RSPHERICAL in [Problem]
As for the logarithmic free energy, what is the issue? Convergence or input?
Guillaume

It is the convergence.
sreekar

Ok, what you did could be more easily done with a DerivativeParseMaterial and the plog function we provide. The whole point of doing a Taylor expansion for small values is to reduce the stiffness of the equation system by dropping to a lower polynomial order. Your 1000 term Taylor expansion is basically indistinguishable from the actual logarithm!

node.title: Units
node.bodyText:
Hello everyone!
Is there a way to check the units of values in my model? Does MOOSE operate in SI units by default?
For instance, are auxkernels of type TotalFreeEnergy operating in joules?

Should be SI units by default everywhere.
Your mesh should be in SI units too for that to be true.
Guillaume

The units in MOOSE depend on the parameterization of your model. Most kernels and materials expect parameters to be supplied by the user using a consistent set of units. Those do not necessarily have to be SI units at all. Some materials and kernels may have default values for certain parameters (such as the Boltzmann constant) that you can override to choose whatever unit system you deem appropriate. Here is an example:

  
    
      moose/modules/phase_field/src/materials/GasFreeEnergyBase.C
    
    
        Lines 24 to 32
      in
      06bc1f7
    
  
  
    

        
          
           params.addParam<Real>("mass_unit_conversion", 
        

        
          
                                 1.0364271410595204e-28, 
        

        
          
                                 "Conversion factor to get the gas atom mass in [eV*s^2/Ang^2] (defaults " 
        

        
          
                                 "to [eV*s^2/(Ang^2*u)])"); 
        

        
          
           params.addParam<Real>("h", 
        

        
          
                                 4.135667662e-15, 
        

        
          
                                 "Planck constant - units need to be consistent with " 
        

        
          
                                 "the units of omega (default in [eV*s])"); 
        

        
          
           params.addParam<Real>("kB", 8.6173303e-5, "Boltzmann constant (default in [eV/K])"); 
        
    
  


In this case it is easiest to just go with the default units of these quantities.
Not that we have a units system (https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/utils/Units.html) that can be used to convert quantities inside your input file.
note that eV is not an SI unit
Ah thanks I did not know about these accommodations. Some modules are better than others wrt accepting other unit systems. Fluid properties doesn't do imperial units.
Very helpful, thank you both!

node.title: Maximum and average values of the elemental values calculated by "ParsedMaterial"
node.bodyText:
Dear MOOSE group,
I can use "ParsedMaterial" to obtain the elemental values. How can I obtain the maximum or average value of these elemental values?
Thanks,
Peng

Hello
I assume you mean on a subdomain-basis for the maximum and average.
Please have a look at
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/ElementExtremeMaterialProperty.html
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/postprocessors/ElementAverageMaterialProperty.html
Guillaume

Yes. Got it. Many thanks.
Peng

node.title: SideSetsBetweenSubdomainsGenerator
node.bodyText:
Hi:  using mesh generators to simplify a larger mesh.  Would like to place a sideset between one large block 'Pebble_Bed' and two adjacent smaller blocks 'Chute_Inlet' and 'Inlet_Annulus'.  I have tried several sets of commands like:
[bottom_ss]
type = SideSetsBetweenSubdomainsGenerator
input = top_ss
new_boundary = 'inlet'
primary_block = 'Pebble_Bed Pebble_Bed'
paired_block = 'Chute_Inlet Inlet_Annulus'
[]
This does generate a sideset, but only between Pebble_Bed and Inlet_Annulus.  Is it possible to do this?
Thanks,
Joe

Hi Joe
Could you please add show_info to the Mesh block and paste the output here?
I have never done it with a single generator, but probably should work. Let s look at the log.
Guillaume

Hi Guillaume:  just after the sidesetgenerator block, I delete all of the blocks except Pebble_Bed.  So, there is a lot of stuff in the log but I don't see anything helpful.  Here it is:

node.title: PETSc error when running MOOSE on Sawtooth (PETSC ERROR: Argument out of range)
node.bodyText:
Hi All,
I hope everyone is doing well.
I have been trying to transition from falcon to sawtooth, but moose simulations that worked on falcon give me a hard time on sawtooth due to PETSc errors.
Below is a description of how I built moose on sawtooth, the pbs file I use, and the type of errors I get (something like [0]PETSC ERROR: ----- Error Message ----- [0]PETSC ERROR: Argument out of range). All three errors were obtained using the exact same input file and pbs file. However, the errors pop up at different time steps. I am not sure where it is coming from and how to solve it. Any insight is welcome.
Let me know if you need additional information.
Thank you very much.
Best,
Pierre-Clement
Build Moose on sawtooth:
Following https://mooseframework.inl.gov/getting_started/installation/hpc_install_moose.html, I:
-used the same .bash_profile that worked on falcon
-created a projects2 folder to differentiate it from the projects folder I use on MOOSE
-cloned moose using:
cd ~/projects2
git clone https://github.com/idaholab/moose.git
cd moose
git checkout master

-loaded the modules I need:
module load use.moose
module load PETSc/3.11.4-GCC

-module list returns:
Currently Loaded Modules:
  1) use.moose   2) gcc/9.2.0-gcc-4.8.5-bxc7   3) mvapich2/2.3.3-gcc-9.2.0   4) miniconda   5) PETSc/3.11.4-GCC

-Compiled libmesh
cd ~/projects2/moose
./scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh

-Compiled and successfully test MOOSE
cd ~/projects2/moose/test
make -j 4
./run_tests -j 4

-made combined
Call (.pbs file):
#!/bin/bash
#PBS -N 3AD1N1GNAS1a
#PBS -m bea
#PBS -j oe
#PBS -l select=6:ncpus=48:mpiprocs=48
#PBS -l walltime=160:00:00
#PBS -P neup
#PBS -k doe

cd /home/simopier/projects2/moose/modules/combined/ZrH_Morphology_5/3D_AD_1N_1G_NAS_1a

cat $PBS_NODEFILE

module load use.moose
module load PETSc/3.11.4-GCC

mpirun /home/simopier/projects2/moose/modules/combined/combined-opt -i ZrH_KKS_KHSHT_AD_3D_1N_1G_NAS_1a.i

Errors:

ERROR 1

Outputting checkpoint   [[33m  1.54 s[39m]
Adaptivity step 1 of 1 .                                                                   [[33m  2.67 s[39m]

Time Step 13, time = 0.00571913, dt = 0.00069657
 0 Nonlinear |R| = [32m4.149829e+05[39m
[102]PETSC ERROR: --------------------- Error Message --------------------------------------------------------------
[102]PETSC ERROR: Argument out of range
[102]PETSC ERROR: Key <= 0
[102]PETSC ERROR: See http://www.mcs.anl.gov/petsc/documentation/faq.html for trouble shooting.
[102]PETSC ERROR: Petsc Release Version 3.11.4, Sep, 28, 2019
[102]PETSC ERROR: /home/simopier/projects2/moose/modules/combined/combined-opt on a  named r3i7n6 by simopier Sun Nov 15 14:40:56 2020
[102]PETSC ERROR: Configure options --COPTFLAGS=-O3 --CXXOPTFLAGS=-O3 --FOPTFLAGS=-O3 --with-x=0 --with-mpi=1 --with-ssl=0 --with-openmp=1 --with-debugging=0 --with-cxx-dialect=C++11 --with-shared-libraries=1 --with-fortran-bindings=0 --with-cxxlib-autodetect=0 --download-mumps=1 --download-hypre=1 --download-metis=1 --download-slepc=1 --download-ptscotch=1 --download-parmetis=1 --download-scalapack=1 --download-fblaslapack=1 --download-superlu_dist=1 AR=ar CC=mpicc CXX=mpicxx FC=mpifort F90=mpifort F77=mpifort --prefix=/apps/moose/stack/petsc-3.11.4_mvapich2-2.3.3_gcc-9.2.0

application called MPI_Abort(MPI_COMM_WORLD, 1) - process 262
@fdkong Do you have an wisdom regarding this error?

@simopier Hey! Just had a discussion with @fdkong and @milljm the other day about building on sawtooth. They discouraged me from using the pre-built PETSc modules because they are not kept up-to-date as much. They recommended building PETSc using the submodule and the scripts/update_and_rebuild_petsc.sh script. The modules I use to do this are:
module load git gcc mvapich2 python cmake

I think I received a private email on this as well.
@simopier I would like you follow the following instructions exactly so that we can stay on the same page.


module purge to clean everything you loaded. It may be even better to open a new terminal. Make sure your environment is very clean.


unset PETSC_DIR PETSC_ARCH


module load mvapich2/2.3.4-gcc-8.4.0-patched cmake


./scripts/update_and_rebuild_petsc.sh --download-mumps=0 --with-64-bit-indices


MOOSE_JOBS=24 ./scripts/update_and_rebuild_libmesh.sh CC=mpicc FC=mpif90 F77=mpif90 CXX=mpicxx


make clobberall to remove all old libs


make -j24


In your PBS file, you may add module load mvapich2/2.3.4-gcc-8.4.0-patched cmake. I usually add this into bash profile, and I will have the same environment next time when I login in the machine.
Please let us know how this works

Thank you very much Fande. I am working on it and update this conversation.
Just to clarify, should I still have
module load use.moose
module load PETSc/3.11.4-GCC

in addition to your recommended
module load mvapich2/2.3.4-gcc-8.4.0-patched cmake

in my pbs file?

NO. The only thing needed is:
module load mvapich2/2.3.4-gcc-8.4.0-patched cmake
Please do not load extra modules.
@fdkong just curious, why that version of mvapich?
I just happened to use  this version of MPI yesterday. I feel more confident that it will work today as well :-)
You gave up MPT, which you recommended to me? ;-)
I will use it for large calculations for production runs

@fdkong, I have followed your instructions and it seems to have solved the issue!
This error is not easy to reproduce, so I am not 100% sure. However, the job launched after following your instructions has now been running significantly longer than it took for the previous ones to crash.
Following on YadiWang's question, would it be interesting for me to use MPT to speed up the runs?
Thank you very much.
@simopier Could you run the same things again and again?

Interesting, I was compiling with the default mvapich2 and it was giving me warnings about incompatible fortran libraries. I went back and recompiled with the gcc-8.4.0 version and the warnings are gone 👍

Which is contributing to these errors, MPI, PETSc, gcc, libMesh or MOOSE? I am asking because I had hard time as well before and the error sometimes is really hard to reproduce. It is pretty frustrating a big job got killed in the middle due to an error like this.
From my understanding, it is a MPI error. Unfortunately, it is extremely hard to debug ...

Hello @fdkong ,
I followed your suggestion  and I could install moose on sawtooth. I faced only one minor issue. I got following error during running test step.

./run_tests -j 24
"TestHarness" requires python version 3.6 or greater, version 2.7 is being used.
You need python3. Do you have a chance to load python 3.6 or greater?

node.title: “Material has no property named: dfundgrad_op”
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone!
I am new to Moose. And I have declared  "dfundgrad_op" in Materials. But when I executed my code, there was still an error suggesting that "Material has no property named: dfundgrad_op”.  I was confused, but I don't know how to deal with it. May someone help me? Thank you very much!
...H
MaterialProperty & _dfundgrad_op;
.....
...C
_dfundgrad_op(declareProperty<RealGradient>("dfundgrad_op")),

....

Does your code compile without error? The first obvious mistake is MaterialProperty & _dfundgrad_op;, which should be specialized to MaterialProperty<RealGradient> & _dfundgrad_op;.
A general suggestion: if you are new to moose, I highly recommend you to go through the workshop. It's a bit lengthy, but definitely worth your time.
I'm puzzled as to why it even compiles... Let's see if someone else can help.

Maybe those files are not being compiled, like the MOOSE_DIR is set somewhere else.
You should get this error
In file included from /home/guillaume/projects/moose/framework/src/materials/GenericConstantMaterial.C:10,
                 from /home/guillaume/projects/moose/framework/build/unity_src/materials_Unity.C:12:
/home/guillaume/projects/moose/framework/build/header_symlinks/GenericConstantMaterial.h:38:3: error: template placeholder type 'MaterialProperty<...auto...>' must be followed by a simple declarator-id
   38 |   MaterialProperty & _dfundgrad_op;
      |   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

specialize means that you give the templated class an argument for the template.
For example vector is a template for vector. If I want a vector of Real, you declare the object as vector. The compiler will know to place Real everywhere in the definition of vector (for example the routines to say how an addition is done, how to take the first element etc)
private / public is about access management, see here

Thank you very much ， I have got it.  The two types did not match when I converted them, but the compiler did not report the error, and it took me a long time to find the problem. Thank you for your tips and suggestions again.

node.title: Use of calculated kernel values in calculation of functions
node.bodyText:
Is it possible to use a function to calculate a value based on a value called into the function from a kernel?  Is it then possible to set that function value equal to the coef/coefficient of CoupledForce and/or CoefReaction respectively?
Thanks

"function to calculate a value based on a value called into the function from a kernel"
well this exactly, not with the Function system.
However, with the Materials system, you could make these two functions material properties, and one can depend on the other, then be called in MatReaction (the equivalent of CoefReaction but with a material property coefficient).
It also could be that you can de-convolute this requirement, and do all this computing in a custom kernel. CoefReaction and CoupledForce are very simple kernels, you could very easily modify them.

node.title: Generating subdomains from the element list?
node.bodyText:
Hi guys,
is it possible to generate subdomains by element list?
from the list under meshgenerators, it doesn't seem like there is one that can do what I want
I could do that by using FileMeshGenerator to import pre-defined subdomains from .inp file (Abaqus).

my ultimate goal is to first, create cohesive surfaces from the subdomains (red/large blocks) using BreakMeshByBlockGenerator then impose the mining-step subdomains into the main mesh (black/small blocks)
so generating subdomains from the element list will help in the later part.

@jiangwen84 @arovinelli, gents, I think this approach can help with my CZM problem, what do you think?
Kind regards,
Traiwit

Hello
There is not. You can use https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/ParsedSubdomainMeshGenerator.html to sort of define the block based on the location of the centroid of the element, which could work here if you convert each block shape into a combinatorial geometry expression.
If you want to work with a list, I think modifying the .inp file, or specifying subblocks in abacus is the way to go here.
Guillaume

ElementSubdomainIDGenerator
is similar to what you need.
The bad part is you have to give all elements a new block id.
The element list is implied to be 0,1,2,...,N
The example below will give to elements  0,1,2,3,4 block id 0 2 3 1 2
  [./subdomains]
    type = ElementSubdomainIDGenerator
    input = gmg
    subdomain_ids = '0 2 3 1 2'
  []

node.title: use of a current kernel variable in another kernel as a coefficient
node.bodyText: I would like to use the resulting value for u1 as a coefficient in the solution of value u2 where u1 is defined in the formula d/dt(u1) = C1u1 and u2 is defined in the formula d/dt(u2)=C2u2+C3*u1. Is there a kernel or a function that I may apply to provide me with the desired coupling?

Hello
You can couple the two equations. I believe the example for coupled force does something very similar to what you want to do.
If you want to use the "resulting" value, so solve one equation, then solve the next one, you will need to use a MultiApp.
Guillaume
Thank you. I was able to do what I wanted by using combinations of CoefReaction and CoupledForce.

node.title: How to output the concentration gradient energy contribution from "CHInterface"
node.bodyText:
Hi everyone,
I use "CHInterface" to calculate the concentration gradient energy. Does anyone know how to output this part gradient energy?

https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/kernels/CHInterface.html
Thanks,
Peng
You can use the TotalFreeEnergy AuxKernel. Just set F_name = 0 to ignore the bulk contribution.
Thanks for your reply. I will try this.
